resource.chars:
Distillation of Cognac : The process of distilling cognac is the same since the seventeenth century. Distillation is carried out in two steps ; it's called "double distillation".

The first distillation is the "heating of wine" at the end of which comes out a brouillis at 30% volume. Then, we reuse the heart of this brouillis to carry out the second distillation which is called: "the good heating". The brandy that comes out it is at 70%. It can be put into oak barrels.
